column1: '''Scary''' was a small settlement that lay in the hilly region of caves and rock holes that formed the northern parts of the [[Eastfarthing]]
column2: which also gave its name to the surrounding [[Hills of Scary|stony hills]].<ref>{{FR|Part}}</ref>

column1: From among the rocky lands around Scary much of [[the Shire]]'s stone was quarried.

column2: the Scary quarries were used by [[Ruffians|Sharkey's Men]] to store their loot
column4: much of this was recovered by the [[Shire-hobbits]].<ref>{{RK|VI9}}</ref>

column1: [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] notes that the name was meaningless in [[Hobbitish]] of the [[War of the Ring]]. However he notes that since it was in a rocky region and of a stone-quarry
column2: it may be supposed to contain English dialectal ''scar''
